Texts.Chs:
FrackinUniverse增加了大量的装甲并加强了一些旧的装甲，允许更多种类的游戏风格。这些装甲在游戏中至关重要，提供非常有用的增益！

^orange;种类^reset;: 普通玩家可能会注意到装甲比他们习惯的种类更多，甚至与他们习惯的种类完全不一样。FU提供了更广泛的各种护甲，以改进您的游戏体验。

如果你对伤害更感兴趣，选择力量装甲或者超力量装甲，用防御属性换攻击属性。或是，选择坦克或强力坦克套装，碾压你的敌人。他们要么近身肉搏，要么远程射击！如果打架不是你的强项？ 选择一个探索导向的套装，在环境中舒适自在！你一定会找到一套适合你的游戏风格的套装！

^orange;抗性^reset;: FU 中的很多铠甲都有固有的抗性。许多生物和气候效果只要忍受片刻就会停止影响你，而且各种各样的敌人攻击会造成较少的伤害。很爽吧？ 它还能变得更好; 升级你的护甲，那些抗性就会增加！

^orange;奖励^reset;: 大多数奖励是在有条件的情况下增加你的属性。 任何^green;+值^reset;都是累加增长。如果装备附加^green;+3%^reset;的暴击几率，那么其会基于你的基础暴击几率增长。 如果它说它附加^green;更多的增益^reset;，其也基于你现有的数值增长(莫名其妙的有1000%的伤害？ 100%的增益后就是2000% !) 小提示: 每秒触发一次回复。

当然，一些附加的隐藏增益我们不能轻易的写在工具提示栏里面，这就靠你自己去发掘了。
此外，还有一些其他词缀需要注意。如果套装奖励声明它对^green;所有相关效应都免疫^reset;，那通常意味着所有生物群系的天气^orange;以及^reset;与该元素相关的特定状态效果都免疫。比如免疫热量，就包括免疫燃烧，甚至免疫熔岩！ 免疫辐射，就包括免疫辐射烧伤。
还有一个小小的提示，一些术语或符号被松散地使用。如果你看到一个带x/y的奖励，这意味着奖励根据他们的条件是如何满足的而不同。对于武器，这意味着有多少这种类型的武器。

^cyan;采矿套装^reset;: 
采矿激光套装可以提供更多的采矿激光伤害...但是如果你同时使用其他类型的武器，这个加成会显著减少。例如，使用矿用激光加手枪，100%的矿用激光伤害加成就会变成25%。
^orange;颜色^reset;: 颜色在套装奖励中很重要。如果条目是^green;绿色^reset;的，那就意味着它是增益。 ^red;红色^reset;意味着减益。^cyan;青色^reset;代表其他的效果。条目之间通常不会叠加相似的效果。

^orange;特殊奖励^reset;: 一些套具有特殊奖励，由于显示空间不足，提示不能显示太多的信息，这是游戏的一个不幸的局限..在这本书里面，我会解释一些奖励的含义。 
^cyan;自动医疗^reset;: 比直接回复更复杂，这个效果将以相同百分比的能量代价每秒恢复更多的生命值。
^cyan;荆棘^reset;: 当收到攻击时释放荆棘新星。
^cyan;召唤奴仆^reset;: 通常是有条件的，召唤伙伴与你并肩作战或替你分散注意力。
^cyan;生命/能量外壳^reset;: 根据你的资源获得伤害吸收，以保护你的健康。如果你最近没有受到伤害，会很快再生。
^cyan;重力正常化: 个人重力太低？那就提高。太高了？那就降低。不过有例外: 零重力。
u^cyan;生力和神像: 这些效果是专有的，并且非常强大; 它们根据一个的百分比来给予一个属性。 生力以生命授予力量，神像以力量授予生命。
^cyan;战斗续行: 当你的生命变低时，增加防御，直到限定的数值，而之后会获得 HP 回复。

^cyan;暗黑指挥者^reset;: 增加附近召唤宠物的伤害、防御、生命值和速度百分比，增加其一半的跳跃能力，并以每秒六分之一的速度恢复生命值。

^cyan魅力^reset;: 关系到你在空间站与贸易商讨价还价的能力。 你的魅力越高，交易就越顺利(而且你的银行存款也会越多!)
Texts.Eng:
FrackinUniverse adds a large amount of armor and enhances some older ones, allowing for a greater variety of playstyles. These can be very useful through gameplay and provide exceptionally useful benefits!

^orange;Stats^reset; : Vanilla players may notice there are more than they are used to, and even the ones they are used to have different ranges. FU presents a wider variety of armor classes to spice up your play.

If you are more interested in damage, pick up Power armor or hyper power armor to trade defensive stats for offensive ones. Alternatively, pick up Tank or Power Tank sets to outlast your enemy. They come in melee OR ranged! Fighting not quite your thing? Pick up an Exploration oriented set, and be at home in your environment! You're guaranteed to locate a set that suits your playstyle somewhere out there!

^orange;Resistances^reset; : Many armors in FU come with inherent resistances. Many biome weather effects will simply stop affecting you once you hit an appropriate amount, and various enemy attacks will do less damage. Nifty, right? It gets better; upgrade your armor, and those resistances will increase!

^orange;Bonuses^reset; : Most are increases to your stats, plenty are conditional. 
Any that say ^green;+value^reset; are additive increases. If it gives ^green;+3%^reset; Crit Chance it increases your base crit chance. If it says it gives ^green;More^reset; of something, that's a multiplier on the value you currently have (Have 1000% Damage somehow? 100% More would make it 2000%!) Small note: Regen procs per second.

Of course, some bonuses have hidden components we couldn't easily include, for tooltip space.
 Additionally, there are some other phrase uses to note. If a set bonus states that it grants immunity to ^green;ALL^reset; of a related effect, that typically means all biome weather ^orange;as well as^reset; specific status effects related to that element. For heat, that includes burning and even lava! For radiation, that includes rad-burn.
As a small side-note, some terms or symbols are used loosely. If you see a bonus with x/y, that means the bonuses are different based on how their conditions are met. For weapons, this means how many of that type.

^cyan;Mining Sets^reset; :
 Mining laser sets grant a lot more mining laser damage...but that bonus is reduced significantly if you are pairing them with something else. Using a mining laser with a pistol, as example: 100% More Mining Laser Damage becomes 25%.
^orange;Colors^reset;: Colors are important in set bonuses. If something is ^green;GREEN^reset;, that means it is a good thing. ^red;RED^reset; means it is a bad thing. ^cyan;Cyan^reset; is for things that are binary. They typically do not stack with similar effects.

^orange;Special Bonuses^reset; : Some sets have special bonuses that don't really display much information due to lack of space, an unfortunate limitation of the game.. Here, some bonuses will be explained.
^cyan;Auto-Medic^reset;: More complicated than straight regen, this effect will restore more health per second at the cost of an equal percentage of energy.

^cyan;Thorns^reset;: a nova of thorns when hit, ^cyan;Fire Burst^reset; makes a nova of fire instead.

^cyan;Summons Minions^reset;: summons short-lived alllies to fight alongside you or distract enemies. These minions scale based on the lowest armor's tier, so upgrading it is essential! Upgrade ALL of the pieces.

^cyan;Life/Energy Shell^reset;: Gain damage absorbtion based on your resources to protect your health. Regenerates quickly if you haven't taken damage recently. ^cyan;Shell Immunities^reset; are granted only while the shell holds.

^cyan;Gravity Normalization^reset;: Personal gravity too low? Up it goes. Too high? Down instead. Exception: Zero-gravity.

^cyan;Vital Power^reset; and ^cyan;Juggernaut^reset;: these effects are set bonus exclusive, and quite powerful; they grant one stat based on a percent of another. Vital power grants power as life, Juggernaut grants life as power.

^cyan;Undying Resolve^reset;: increases Protection as your life gets lower, up to the stated amount, while Immortal Resolve grants HP Regen instead.

^cyan;Dark Commander^reset;: Increases Damage, Protection, HP and Speed of nearby summoned pets by the listed percent, increases their jump ability by half of that, and regenerates HP at a sixth of that amount per second.

^cyan;Charisma^reset;: Your ability to bargain with Traders at space stations. The higher your charisma, the better the deal (and fatter your bank balance!)
